excerpt: Fortress on a rocky point at bay entrance offering guided tours & scenic view of Sugarloaf Mountain.
detail_description: Fortaleza de Santa Cruz da Barra is a historic fortress located in Niteroi, Brazil. It boasts stunning architecture and is one of the oldest and most significant historical sites in the country. The fortress offers guided tours and provides visitors with breathtaking views of Guanabara Bay and Sugarloaf Mountain. As a main defensive structure during the colonial and imperial periods, it holds great historical importance. The site attracts tourists and researchers alike, seeking both leisure and insight into Brazil's past.
name: Fortaleza de Santa Cruz da Barra
address: Estr. Gen. Eurico Gaspar Dutra - Jurujuba, Niterói - RJ, 24370-375, Brazil

excerpt: Large collection of modern art in an iconic building by the renowned architect Oscar Niemeyer.
detail_description: The Museu de Arte Contemporânea de Niterói is a must-visit for art and architecture enthusiasts. Designed by the renowned architect Oscar Niemeyer, this iconic modernist building offers panoramic views and an impressive collection of contemporary art.
name: Museu de Arte Contemporânea de Niterói
address: Mirante da Boa Viagem, s/nº - Boa Viagem, Niterói - RJ, 24210-390, Brazil

excerpt: This 396m-tall peak on a peninsula jutting out into the ocean features a cableway & sweeping views.
detail_description: Sugarloaf Mountain, a 396m-tall peak on a peninsula with sweeping views and accessible by cableway, is one of the most iconic rocks in the world. It offers breathtaking views of Rio de Janeiro from its peak and is accessible by a thrilling glass-walled cable car journey. Additionally, visitors can enjoy an Instagram-worthy breakfast at Parque Gloria Maria with views of Guanabara Bay and Sugarloaf Mountain.
name: Sugarloaf Mountain
address: Urca, Rio de Janeiro - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

detail_description: Rampa de Voo Parque da Cidade is a popular spot for adventure enthusiasts in Niteroi. This public park, situated 270 meters above sea level, offers breathtaking views of Rio de Janeiro. Visitors can witness paragliding and hang gliding from the two ramps within the park. Additionally, there's a cozy cafe where you can savor breakfast or snacks while taking in the stunning scenery.
name: Rampa de Voo Parque da Cidade
address: Charitas, Niterói - RJ, Brazil

excerpt: Surfing beach with natural rock pools for swimming & hiking trails on nearby headlands.
detail_description: Itacoatiara Beach, also known as Itacoa by the locals, is a popular destination in Niteroi, Brazil. Accessible by ferry boat from Praca XV or by car via the Rio-Niteroi bridge, this beach offers natural rock pools for swimming and hiking trails on nearby headlands. The area has taken steps to preserve its natural environment by prohibiting beachfront constructions of more than 2 floors. It's a surfer's paradise and a perfect retreat from city life.
name: Itacoatiara Beach
address: Itacoatiara, Niterói - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

excerpt: Hilltop park with iconic views of Guanabara Bay & surrounding hills, plus a paragliding launch.
detail_description: Niterói City Park is a breathtaking hilltop destination that offers stunning panoramic views of Guanabara Bay and the surrounding hills. This park, perched at an altitude of 270 meters, is a haven for adventure seekers with its paragliding and hang gliding launch sites. Even on overcast days, visitors can marvel at iconic landmarks such as the Christ the Redeemer statue and Sugarloaf Mountain from its scenic belvedere.
name: Niterói City Park
address: Estr. Viracao, s/n - São Francisco, Niterói - RJ, 26177-600, Brazil

excerpt: Acclaimed bayside venue for art, history & culture housed in imaginative organic buildings.
detail_description: Caminho Niemeyer is an 11-kilometer long cultural center located along the Niteroi coast, featuring a collection of imaginative and organic buildings designed by the renowned Brazilian architect Oscar Niemeyer. The area serves as a showcase of his work, including the modernist concrete curves of the Teatro Popular and other structures. It was created to revitalize the region and has become a prominent venue for art, history, and culture.
name: Caminho Niemeyer
address: R. Jorn. Rogério Coelho Neto, s/n - Centro, Niterói - RJ, 24020-011, Brazil

detail_description: The Janete Costa Museum of Popular Art, situated in a historic mansion dating back to 1892 in the Inga neighborhood of Nitero, Brazil, offers a unique blend of art and history. The museum is committed to showcasing works by popular Brazilian artists and aims to provide an enriching experience for visitors interested in learning about Brazilian art. With well-organized exhibitions featuring beautiful works set against the backdrop of the museum's charming architecture, it offers free admission and friendly staff.
name: Janete Costa Museum of Popular Art
address: R. Pres. Domiciano, 178 - Ingá, Niterói - RJ, 24210-271, Brazil

detail_description: Praça Arariboia, inaugurated in 1973 to commemorate the city's 400th anniversary, replaced a bronze bust honoring a local chief. Formerly known as Largo Martim Afonso or Largo do Mercado, it once hosted a public market until its dismantling in 1889. The square now features a modern waterway station and offers pleasant ferry trips, despite some disagreement about the fare.
name: Praça Arariboia
address: Praça Araribóia - Centro, Niterói - RJ, 24020-030, Brazil

name: Pedra do Elefante
address: Serra da tiririca - Mata Atlântica, Maricá - RJ, 24930-000, Brazil

detail_description: Costão de Itacoatiara is a popular trail that offers a daily cardio workout. It's relatively short, taking about an hour to complete the round trip. The route starts with a forest staircase and then leads to a steep cliff, where hikers can use steel cables for assistance. While some find it intense, others consider it to be a light trail, making it suitable for both beginners and experienced hikers alike.
name: Costão de Itacoatiara
address: R. das Papoulas, 75-67 - Itacoatiara, Niterói - RJ, 24348-290, Brazil

excerpt: Storied, Parisian-style theater from 1909 offering ballet & classical-music performances plus tours.
detail_description: The Municipal Theater of Rio de Janeiro, built in the early 1900s, is a stunning Parisian-style venue known for its ballet and classical music performances. It is considered one of the most beautiful and significant theaters in Brazil. Visitors can explore the city center to discover architectural marvels like this theater and enjoy cultural experiences at places such as Centro Cultural Banco do Brasil.
name: Municipal Theater of Rio de Janeiro
address: Praça Floriano, S/N - Centro, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20031-050, Brazil

excerpt: Vibrant, bohemian Lapa is renowned for its traditional bars, live music clubs, dance halls and the open-air samba jams held beneath the Roman-style Arcos da Lapa aqueduct. Another nightlife hub is the area around the Escadaria Selarón, an iconic stairway adorned with a mosaic of hand-painted tiles. By day, design enthusiasts browse the vintage and antiques stores on Rua do Lavradio and Rua do Senado.
detail_description: Lapa is a lively and bohemian district in Rio de Janeiro, known for its vibrant nightlife and cultural attractions. The area is famous for its traditional bars, live music clubs, and dance halls, as well as the open-air samba jams held beneath the iconic Arcos da Lapa aqueduct.
name: Lapa
address: Rio de Janeiro - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

excerpt: Park with an art gallery built around the ruins of a mansion, plus live outdoor concerts & a cafe.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant neighborhood of Santa Teresa, Parque das Ruínas is a captivating public park that beautifully combines history and art. This enchanting destination features an art gallery built around the remnants of a grand mansion, offering visitors a glimpse into the past while enjoying contemporary artistic expressions. Families can embark on an exciting cable car ride to reach this elevated oasis, making it an adventure for all ages.
name: Parque das Ruínas
address: R. Murtinho Nobre, 169 - Santa Teresa, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20241-050, Brazil

excerpt: Guided tours offered in an ornate, 19th-century palace with a tower & museum exhibits.
detail_description: Ilha Fiscal is a must-visit destination in Rio de Janeiro, offering guided tours of an ornate 19th-century palace with a tower and museum exhibits. The island has historical significance as it was conquered by the Portuguese in the 16th century. It also features churches like Igreja Nossa Senhora da Penha and Igreja Nossa Senhora de Bonsucesso, both holding rich historical and architectural value.
name: Ilha Fiscal
address: Centro, Rio de Janeiro - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

excerpt: This 8.26-mile concrete bridge between Rio & Niterói is one of the longest in the world.
detail_description: Ponte Pres. Costa e Silva, also known as the Rio-Niterói Bridge, is an impressive 8.26-mile concrete bridge connecting Rio de Janeiro and Niterói. The bridge offers stunning views of Guanabara Bay and its surroundings, including the iconic Christ the Redeemer statue, Corcovado Mountain, and Maracana Stadium.
name: Ponte Pres. Costa e Silva (Rio-Niterói)
address: Brazil

excerpt: Forest park with hilly terrain & rock-climbing, plus hiking trails leading to scenic ocean views.
detail_description: The Serra da Tiririca State Park includes dense forest and hills, making it a great place to hike and rock climb. The park also has several trails leading to ocean views.
name: Serra da Tiririca State Park
address: R. das Rosas, 24 - Itacoatiara, Niterói - RJ, 24348-290, Brazil

excerpt: Relaxed park featuring a lake with a fountain, a kids' play area & a weekend handicrafts market.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Icarai, Campo de São Bento is a delightful public park that offers an inviting escape from the urban bustle. Spanning over 20 acres, this green oasis features serene walking paths and picturesque ponds, making it ideal for leisurely strolls or peaceful picnics. Families will appreciate the well-equipped playgrounds and various activities available for children.
name: Campo de São Bento
address: Alameda Edmundo de Macedo Soares e Silva, s/n - Icaraí, Niterói - RJ, 24230-161, Brazil

detail_description: Sossego Beach, or Praia do Sossego, is a hidden gem that embodies tranquility and natural beauty. This small beach has earned an international Blue Flag sustainability certificate, highlighting its commitment to environmental preservation. Tucked away past Camboinhas, it remains relatively undiscovered by tourists, allowing for a serene atmosphere where visitors can truly unwind.
name: Sossego Beach
address: State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

detail_description: If you're in the mood for some Brazilian barbecue, Mocellin Churrascaria is the place to go. With a wide selection of dishes that include steak, chicken, and pork, there's something for everyone. You can also enjoy sushi and other South American specialties here. And if you're looking to get a little naughty late at night, this place has you covered with its private dining options.
name: Mocellin Churrascaria
address: Av. Quintino Bocaiúva, 151 - São Francisco, Niterói - RJ, 24360-022, Brazil

detail_description: Família Paludo is a beloved spot for enjoying meats and socializing over wine. With its à la carte system, diners can select their preferred cut to be prepared on the Uruguayan grill. The restaurant offers a variety of delicious sides, including grilled vegetables, potatoes, and risottos. Visitors praise the impeccable quality of the meat and the extensive drink selection. The establishment also receives accolades for its friendly service and scenic views.
name: Família Paludo
address: Av. Quintino Bocaiúva, 247 - São Francisco, Niterói - RJ, 24360-022, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant neighborhood of Cafuba, Restaurante Seu Antônio stands out as a must-visit culinary gem in Niterói. Renowned for its cozy and laid-back atmosphere, this restaurant specializes in Brazilian cuisine with an emphasis on seafood delights. If you're a shrimp lover, you simply cannot miss their signature dish: shrimp served in coconut. The menu is brimming with mouthwatering seafood options and Portuguese-inspired dishes that showcase the freshest ingredients available.
name: Restaurante Seu Antônio
address: R. Dr. Heleno de Gregório, 312 - Cafubá, Niterói - RJ, 24350-065, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant craft-beer scene of Rio, Noi is a delightful restaurant and brewery that offers an impressive selection of brews alongside mouthwatering dishes. With nine unique beers crafted at their Nitero brewery, guests can enjoy these refreshing drinks paired with local snacks like bolinhos de feijoada or shiitake-stuffed pasteis. The menu boasts a variety of options, including succulent steaks, fresh seafood, and traditional Brazilian fare.
name: Noi
address: Av. Quintino Bocaiúva, 201 - São Francisco, Niterói - RJ, 24360-022, Brazil

detail_description: Camboinhas Beach, nestled in the charming city of Niterói, Brazil, is a hidden gem that beckons travelers seeking tranquility and natural beauty. With its soft white sands and crystal-clear waters boasting a stunning greenish hue, this beach offers an idyllic escape from the bustling crowds of Rio de Janeiro. The serene atmosphere makes it perfect for those looking to unwind while soaking up picturesque views.
name: Camboinhas Beach, Niterói - RJ
address: Av. Beira-Mar, 2095 - Camboinhas, Niterói - RJ, 24320-330, Brazil

excerpt:
Itaipu is a Brazilian district within the municipality of Niterói, in Rio de Janeiro state. It is located at the Oceanic Region of Niterói, which means that its beach is outside the Guanabara Bay.
In the colonial time, Itaipu had a strong economy, based on providing agricultural products to the city of Rio de Janeiro. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Itaipu is a district in Niterói, Rio de Janeiro state, situated in the Oceanic Region. Historically, Itaipu was known for its strong economy based on supplying agricultural products to Rio de Janeiro. While not having a dedicated children's area, Tutti Amici Gastronomia offers an attraction where kids can make their own pizzas and has five dishes specifically for them.
name: Itaipu
address: Niterói - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

detail_description: Pão de Açúcar is a supermarket located in the Urca neighborhood, near Praia Vermelha. It's known for its fresh fruits and vegetables, pharmacy, and reasonably priced restaurant. The bakery next to the restaurant offers delicious options like Ciabatta with buffalo mozzarella. While it has great opening hours and a wide variety of products, shopping late at night may result in long queues. Despite being considered expensive by some, it offers unique products that are hard to find elsewhere.
name: Pão de Açúcar
address: R. Dr. Paulo Alves, 42 - Ingá, Niterói - RJ, 24210-445, Brazil

excerpt: Jurujuba is a promontory and one of the 48 administrative districts of Niterói, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It is located in the southern zone of the city, situated on the coast of the Guanabara Bay. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Nestled along the stunning coastline of Guanabara Bay, Jurujuba is a charming promontory and one of Niterói's 48 administrative districts in Rio de Janeiro. This vibrant neighborhood is steeped in history, particularly as a fishing community that has significantly contributed to the city's cultural tapestry. As you stroll through its main street, you'll be greeted by an array of colorful boats bobbing gently on the water, creating a picturesque scene that captures the essence of coastal life.
name: Jurujuba
address: Niterói - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

excerpt:
São Francisco is one of the 48 neighborhoods in which the Brazilian city of Niterói is divided. As of 2000, its population was 9,654.
Its name derives from the church consecrated to Saint Francis Xavier and references to it can be found as early as the 17th century. Wikipedia.
detail_description: São Francisco, a charming neighborhood in Niterói, Brazil, is steeped in history and culture. Named after the church dedicated to Saint Francis Xavier, its roots trace back to the 17th century. With a population of around 9,654 as of 2000, this area offers a blend of residential tranquility and vibrant community life.
name: São Francisco
address: Niterói - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

detail_description: The MAC Scandal may have stirred up some controversy regarding land deals prior to its grand opening, but the brand's striking and modern design has captivated visitors from around the globe. Travelers flock to experience its unique aesthetic and vibrant atmosphere. Many fans of MAC rave about their extensive range of products, often sharing delightful experiences with attentive staff who are eager to assist in finding the perfect items for every skin type.
name: MAC
address: Rua Quinze de Novembro, 08 - Piso 3 Loja 3008 - Centro, Niterói - RJ, 24020-125, Brazil

detail_description: Embark on an unforgettable journey along the Darwin Route, a scenic 74-kilometer path that meanders through stunning landscapes and rustic signage. Starting at the Praca Arariboia waterway station in central Niterói, this route hugs the picturesque Guanabara Bay and leads to Praia das Flechas. Along the way, you'll encounter breathtaking views of Ilha da Boa Viagem and intriguing caves beneath the iconic Museum of Contemporary Art (MAC).
name: Mac Shop Equipamentos
address: R. São José, 277 - Fonseca, Niterói - RJ, Brazil

excerpt: Iconic, 2.2-mile beach features a wide, sandy expanse, bustling promenade, food kiosks & hotels.
detail_description: Copacabana Beach is an iconic 2.2-mile stretch of sandy coastline with a bustling promenade, food kiosks, and hotels. The beach extends for about 4km and offers a lively atmosphere with soccer players, locals, and tourists enjoying caipirinhas at the kiosks. Visitors can also witness kids showcasing their soccer skills and beach vendors selling various items. It's recommended to check the water quality before swimming due to occasional contamination after heavy rainfall.
name: Copacabana Beach
address: Copacabana, Rio de Janeiro - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

excerpt: A short hike leads to this 220-m. summit with an aerial tram station to Sugarloaf Mountain.
detail_description: Morro da Urca, also known as Urca Hill, is a popular hiking destination in Rio de Janeiro. The mountain stands at 722 feet and offers stunning views of the city and the sea. The 2-mile trail takes about 1.5 hours to complete and features beautiful flora and wooden stairs along the way. At around 200 meters above sea level, visitors can enjoy a unique dining experience at the 200 QUOTA restaurant, accessed by cable car.
name: Morro da Urca
address: Urca, Rio de Janeiro - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

excerpt: Scenic trail winding through native jungle with opportunities to see & hear local birdlife.
detail_description: Pista Cláudio Coutinho is a delightful and scenic trail located near Praia Vermelha, offering a short but beautiful hike through native jungle. The wide and shady path follows the coast alongside Sugarloaf, providing opportunities to observe local birdlife such as tanagers, vultures, and hummingbirds. Visitors may also encounter marmosets and rock skinks along the way.
name: Pista Cláudio Coutinho
address: Urca, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 22290-270, Brazil

excerpt: Famed for its crescent-shaped beach, Copacabana is one of Rio’s liveliest neighborhoods, drawing a cross-section of locals and visitors to round-the-clock activity along its sands and mosaic-tiled promenade. Amid the high-rises overlooking the beach are the art deco Copacabana Palace hotel and imposing Copacabana Fort, home to a military museum. Inland, laid-back sidewalk cafes and casual bars line tranquil streets.
detail_description: Copacabana, located in Rio de Janeiro, is a vibrant neighborhood known for its crescent-shaped beach and lively atmosphere. The area features high-rise buildings overlooking the beach, including the iconic Copacabana Palace hotel and the imposing Copacabana Fort. Inland, tranquil streets are lined with laid-back sidewalk cafes and casual bars. The neighborhood is part of Rio's cultural hub, offering a rich gastronomic history influenced by indigenous, European, African, and Asian flavors.
name: Copacabana
address: Rio de Janeiro - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

excerpt: Fortress backdrop for the triathlon & paratriathlon transition area, road cycling & the marathon.
detail_description: Located at the end of Copacabana's beach, Copacabana Fort is a military base open to the public. It offers stunning views of the beach and ocean, as well as a chance to enjoy amenities like Confeitaria Colombo, a renowned cafe serving delicious meals. The fort also features exhibitions on Brazilian army history. Visitors can take in the expansive view of Copacabana beach while seated at outdoor cafes within the fort.
name: Copacabana Fort (Army History Museum and Copacabana Fort)
address: Praça Cel. Eugênio Franco, 1, Posto 6 - Copacabana, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 22070-020, Brazil

excerpt: Surfing beach with natural rock pools for swimming & hiking trails on nearby headlands.
name: Itacoatiara Beach
address: Itacoatiara, Niterói - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

excerpt: Area of Atlantic Forest, with streams & trails, as well as playground, sculptures & the City Museum.
name: Parque Natural Municipal da Cidade
address: Est. Santa Marinha, 505 - Gávea, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 22451-240, Brazil

excerpt: This iconic beach on Guanabara Bay features 2 famous rock formations & hosts various public events.
detail_description: Praia de Icaraí is an iconic beach located on Guanabara Bay, known for its two famous rock formations and as a venue for various public events. Often compared to Copacabana, it boasts high-rise buildings, bustling commerce, lively bars and restaurants, and a vibrant promenade. Despite the bay's pollution making it unsuitable for swimming, the beach offers a pleasant setting for leisurely strolls.
name: Praia de Icaraí
address: State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

name: Prainha
address: Jardim Imbuí, Niterói - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

name: San Francisco Beach
address: State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

excerpt: This 1.24-mi. marked trail in a nature preserve ascends 711 ft. to a panoramic mountain viewpoint.
detail_description: Shore of Itacoatiara is a stunning destination known for its breathtaking views and outdoor activities. The 1.24-mile marked trail in the nature preserve offers a relatively short but challenging ascent, rewarding hikers with panoramic vistas of Itacoatiara Beach, Niteroi, and parts of Rio de Janeiro. The west-facing orientation makes it an ideal spot to witness mesmerizing sunsets. Visitors recommend avoiding the warmest hours of the day and wearing appropriate footwear for the hike.
name: Shore of Itacoatiara
address: R. das Rosas, 24 - Itacoatiara, Niterói - RJ, 24348-120, Brazil

excerpt: Relaxed city beach featuring swimming & boating, plus nearby restaurants & cafes.
name: Itaipu Beach
address: Itaipu, Niterói - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant city of Niterói, the Teatro Municipal de Niterói stands as a cultural beacon, inviting visitors to immerse themselves in its rich artistic offerings. On November 12th, this historic venue will host the Itinerant Exhibition "Imagens do Marazul," showcasing captivating photographs that celebrate significant moments from local music festivals and the musical scene of Niterói.
name: Teatro Municipal de Niterói
address: Rua Quinze de Novembro, 35 - Centro, Niterói - RJ, 24020-125, Brazil

detail_description: Praia de Charitas offers a captivating setting for leisurely walks in the late afternoon. With its well-lit and secure environment, visitors can revel in the magnificent backdrop of Rio. Although some may have noted that there was an abundance of debris, it did not hinder their enjoyment. This charming location presents a pleasant ambiance and breathtaking scenery, making it an ideal spot to while away the hours.
name: Praia de Charitas
address: Charitas, Niterói - State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

detail_description: Jambeiro Manor is a museum in Niteroi, Brazil, that offers cultural presentations (live music and art) in a relaxing scenario. It is a nice place, with an exuberant almost impossible beauty of Brazil well preserved.
name: Jambeiro Manor
address: R. Pres. Domiciano, 195 - Ingá, Niterói - RJ, 24210-271, Brazil

detail_description: Teatro Popular Oscar Niemeyer is a significant cultural and tourist complex located in Niteroi, Brazil. Designed by the renowned architect Oscar Niemeyer, it is part of the larger Niemeyer Way architectural ensemble along Guanabara Bay. The theater offers a diverse program that encompasses various art forms such as music, photography, dance, painting, and theater. Visitors can explore the striking architecture and take guided tours to learn about its history while enjoying picturesque views of the surrounding area.
name: Teatro Popular Oscar Niemeyer
address: R. Jorn. Rogério Coelho Neto, s/n - Centro, Niterói - RJ, 24020-011, Brazil

name: UFF Arts Center
address: R. Miguel de Frias, 9 - Icaraí, Niterói - RJ, 24220-900, Brazil

detail_description: The Catholic Church Basílica Nossa Senhora Auxiliadora is a beautiful church with a beautiful square and commerce nearby. The peace it provides is stunning.
name: Basílica De Nossa Senhora Auxiliadora
address: R. Santa Rosa, 216 - Santa Rosa, Niterói - RJ, 24240-225, Brazil

detail_description: Praia de Adão is a tranquil beach, perfect for families with small children due to its calm, clean, and safe environment within a military area. Visitors can enjoy delicious food at the nearby restaurant. This hidden gem is located next to a fort and offers great opportunities for fishing and having a barbecue, making it an ideal spot for family outings.
name: Praia de Adão
address: State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

detail_description: The Church of Our Lady of Conception in Niterói is a beautiful and well-maintained place of worship. The parish priest who presides over it, Jose Marcelo, is friendly and knowledgeable, and his presence provides a sense of warmth and welcome to the congregation. Thanks to Father Marcelo's leadership, the church is thriving and benefiting many people.
name: Igreja Nossa Senhora da Conceição de Niterói
address: R. da Conceição, 216 - Centro, Niterói - RJ, 24020-080, Brazil
